scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers of the Sons of Temperance include minutes, 1848-1857; account books of dues, 1849-1868, 1873-1888; rosters of members suspended or expelled, 1840-1860, 1866; list of associate members, 1878-1887; a name index, n.d.; a list of members who pledged total abstinence, 1876-1888; and miscellaneous material including receipts, songs, a thesis on pneumonia, 1869, for the Medical College of Virginia faculty by E.C. Staller, and a blacksmith's account book, 1815-1826.

did.unittitle: Sons of Temperance: society business, miscellaneous. Includes ritual songs for meetings, receipts, and a thesis on pneumonia prepared for the faculty of the Medical College of Virginia in 1869 by E.C. Staller 1848-1892, n.d.
Account book of blacksmith Gabriel Stickley (1815-1826). Includes letter (1814) from a Rabaiah Stickley of Shenandoah County to his unnamed brother-in-law concerning military service 1815-1826

Account book of general activities, purchases of produce, daily labor (1849-1853, 1874). Laid in the volume are two exercise books ascribed to a William Marshall, from his school days and beyond (1819, 1825-1855) 1819-1855
"Alphabet of Divisions." Rosters of members expelled or suspended with date of action, name, and occupation from the Mount Crawford, Marshall, Valley, Rockingham, and Fountain Divisions 1846-1860

Minutes of meetings, Mount Crawford Division. Appended are a list of divisions in Rockingham County, list of corresponding divisions elsewhere in the Shenandoah Valley, and a list of eligible officers 1848-1856
Account book of dues received from the Mount Crawford Division 1849-1853
Records of Degree Division No. 19, Mount Crawford. Minutes of meetings (1855-1857); list of persons expelled (1866); list of associate members (1878-1882) 1855-1882
Account book presumably of a blacksmith 1876-1884
Lists of associates, mostly women, a few boys, a rare man 1882-1887
Account book of dues paid and owed by members. Includes list (1876-1888) of members who had taken pledges of total abstinence, with name, and often age, occupation and address 1874-1888
